SEARCH
Package bookstoreinventorymanagementsystem

Class ValidationHandler

java.lang.Object
bookstoreinventorymanagementsystem.ValidationHandler
public class ValidationHandler extends Object
This class provides methods for validating user inputs, such as username, email, password etc.

      public ValidationHandler()

  • Method Details

    • validateUsername

      public static ValidationResult validateUsername(String username)
      Validates username to ensure it meets length requirements. Usernames must be between 6 and 16 characters long.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to validate.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult indicating whether the username is valid.

    • checkUniqueUsername

      public static ValidationResult checkUniqueUsername(String username) throws SQLException
      Checks if a username already exists in the database. This method queries the database to determine if the provided username is already in use.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check for uniqueness.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult indicating whether the username is unique.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • checkUsernameExistence

      public static ValidationResult checkUsernameExistence(String username) throws SQLException
      Checks if a username exists in the database. This method queries the database to determine if the provided username exists.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check for existence.
      Returns:
      A ValidationResult indicating whether the username exists.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • validateEmail

      public static ValidationResult validateEmail(String email)
      Validates an email address to ensure it has a valid format. The provided email address must contains a username, followed by the '@' symbol, and then a domain name with at least one dot, such as "user@example.com".
      Parameters:
      email - the email address to validate.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult object indicating whether the email address is valid.

    • validatePassword

      public static ValidationResult validatePassword(String password)
      Validates a password to ensure it meets length and format requirements. The password must be between 8 and 16 characters long and contain a combination of numbers, letters, and symbols.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to validate.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult indicating whether the password is valid.

    • confirmPasswordMatches

      public static ValidationResult confirmPasswordMatches(String password, String confirmPassword)
      Checks if two passwords match.
      Parameters:
      password - the first password.
      confirmPassword - the second password to compare against the first.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult indicating whether the passwords match.

    • validateVerificationCode

      public static ValidationResult validateVerificationCode(String entered, String actual)
      Validates verification code entered by the user against the actual verification code to determine if they match.
      Parameters:
      entered - the verification code entered by the user.
      actual - the actual verification code.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult indicating whether the codes match.
